TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MimePart extends System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension

Docs.summary: Represents an extensibility element added to a , specifying the concrete MIME type for the to which the applies. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about specifying protocols for XML Web services, see [[\<topic://cpconbuildingaspnetwebservices>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01dfc27c-c68e-4910-a0aa-5e4c2a766b0c). For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the methods and properties exposed by the `MimePart` class.
[!code-cpp[MimePart_3#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_38_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[MimePart_3#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_38_1.cs)] [!code-vb[MimePart_3#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_38_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the collection of MIME extensibility elements for the part of the of which the is a member.
Docs.value: A collection of service description format extension.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This collection must have at least one member. If it has more than one member, the members are alternative MIME formats for the current <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MimePart>. Members can be of the following types:
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MimeContentBinding>
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MimeXmlBinding>
- <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBodyBinding>
Each of these classes exposes a `Part` property specifying the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> with which the `MimePart` is associated. If this collection has no members, the XML Web service will fail to generate a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file when it is requested. For more information about how MIME extends WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples MimePart_3#3
